S3.T1.caption: TABLE I: Framework for ECT model for multi-human, multi-robot (MH-MR) systems. This framework addresses human trust in robot performance during MH-MR collaboration.
S3.T1.table:
Concept                       Definition                       Formula
Initial Trust (T0⁢rsubscript𝑇0𝑟T_{0r}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) The initial trust in a robot (r𝑟ritalic_r) is derived from prior performance, perception, or predefined assumptions about the robot’s capabilities. T0⁢r=f⁢(prior knowledge, robot specifications)subscript𝑇0𝑟𝑓prior knowledge, robot specificationsT_{0r}=f(\text{prior knowledge, robot specifications})italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_f ( prior knowledge, robot specifications )
Initial Expectation (E0⁢rsubscript𝐸0𝑟E_{0r}italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) Initial expectations for robot r𝑟ritalic_r are set based on the task’s complexity, the environment, and the robot’s capabilities. E0⁢r=g⁢(task complexity, robot capability)subscript𝐸0𝑟𝑔task complexity, robot capabilityE_{0r}=g(\text{task complexity, robot capability})italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_g ( task complexity, robot capability )
Performance Evaluation (Pi⁢rsubscript𝑃𝑖𝑟P_{ir}italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) After the robot executes a task (i𝑖iitalic_i), its performance is evaluated using metrics such as completion time, accuracy, and completion rate. Pi⁢r=h⁢(completion time, accuracy, adaptability)subscript𝑃𝑖𝑟ℎcompletion time, accuracy, adaptabilityP_{ir}=h(\text{completion time, accuracy, adaptability})italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_h ( completion time, accuracy, adaptability )
Performance Comparison The robot’s actual performance is compared to the expected performance to determine the degree of expectation confirmation. Δi⁢r=Pi⁢r−Ei−1⁢rsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑟subscript𝑃𝑖𝑟subscript𝐸𝑖1𝑟\Delta_{ir}=P_{ir}-E_{i-1r}roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
Interpretation: • Δi⁢r>0subscriptΔ𝑖𝑟0\Delta_{ir}>0roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0: Positive confirmation (robot exceeds expectations). • Δi⁢r≤0subscriptΔ𝑖𝑟0\Delta_{ir}\leq 0roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ 0: Negative or neutral confirmation.
Trust Update Function Trust in robot r𝑟ritalic_r is updated based on the performance comparison (Δi⁢rsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑟\Delta_{ir}roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT) using a non-linear function to avoid drastic trust shifts due to isolated events. Ti⁢r=Ti−1⁢r+α×tanh⁡(β×Δi⁢r)subscript𝑇𝑖𝑟subscript𝑇𝑖1𝑟𝛼𝛽subscriptΔ𝑖𝑟T_{ir}=T_{i-1r}+\alpha\times\tanh(\beta\times\Delta_{ir})italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_α × roman_tanh ( italic_β × roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

where α𝛼\alphaitalic_α is the learning rate, determining how quickly trust adjusts, β𝛽\betaitalic_β is the scaling factor that controls the influence of Δi⁢rsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑟\Delta_{ir}roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT on trust change, and the hyperbolic tangent function (tanh\tanhroman_tanh) ensures changes in trust are gradual and bounded.
Trust Decay Trust diminishes over time in the absence of interactions, accounting for the fading impact of past experiences. Ti⁢r=(1−γ)×Ti−1⁢r+α×tanh⁡(β×Δi⁢r)subscript𝑇𝑖𝑟1𝛾subscript𝑇𝑖1𝑟𝛼𝛽subscriptΔ𝑖𝑟T_{ir}=(1-\gamma)\times T_{i-1r}+\alpha\times\tanh(\beta\times\Delta_{ir})italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( 1 - italic_γ ) × italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_α × roman_tanh ( italic_β × roman_Δ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

where γ𝛾\gammaitalic_γ is the decay rate, indicating how quickly trust diminishes without recent interactions, and Ti⁢r=min⁡(max⁡(Ti⁢r,0),1).subscript𝑇𝑖𝑟subscript𝑇𝑖𝑟01T_{ir}=\min(\max(T_{ir},0),1).italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_min ( roman_max ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , 0 ) , 1 ) .
Trust Facets Trust is multi-dimensional, incorporating aspects like competence, ability, and dependability. Ti⁢r=w1⁢Tcom,i⁢r+w2⁢Tabi,i⁢r+w3⁢Tdep,i⁢rsubscript𝑇𝑖𝑟subscript𝑤1subscript𝑇com𝑖𝑟subscript𝑤2subscript𝑇abi𝑖𝑟subscript𝑤3subscript𝑇dep𝑖𝑟T_{ir}=w_{1}T_{\text{com},ir}+w_{2}T_{\text{abi},ir}+w_{3}T_{\text{dep},ir}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT com , italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT abi , italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT dep , italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

where w1,w2subscript𝑤1subscript𝑤2w_{1},w_{2}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and w3subscript𝑤3w_{3}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are weights reflecting the relative importance of each trust component.
Task Allocation Decision Updated trust levels guide the allocation of tasks to robots. Ai+1⁢r=f⁢(Ti⁢r,task priority, team workload)subscript𝐴𝑖1𝑟𝑓subscript𝑇𝑖𝑟task priority, team workloadA_{i+1r}=f(T_{ir},\text{task priority, team workload})italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_f ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , task priority, team workload )
Allocation Criteria: • High Trust: Robots with higher trust levels receive more complex tasks. • Low Trust: Robots with lower trust are assigned simpler tasks or monitored more closely.
Team Trust Aggregation Aggregates individual trust assessments to derive a collective trust measure for each robot. Tteam⁢r⁢(t)=1m⁢∑i=1mTi⁢r⁢(t)subscript𝑇team𝑟𝑡1𝑚superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑚subscript𝑇𝑖𝑟𝑡T_{\text{team}r}(t)=\frac{1}{m}\sum_{i=1}^{m}T_{ir}(t)italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT team italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t )

which provides an overall trust level that reflects the team’s collective confidence in each robot.
Incorporating Team Trust in Task Allocation Incorporates team trust into task allocation decisions. Ai+1⁢r=f⁢(Tteam⁢r⁢(t),task priority, team workload)subscript𝐴𝑖1𝑟𝑓subscript𝑇team𝑟𝑡task priority, team workloadA_{i+1r}=f(T_{\text{team}r}(t),\text{task priority, team workload})italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_f ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT team italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , task priority, team workload )
references: The ECT model includes several components as illustrated in Fig. 2, including initial trust, which is often based on the assumption of a robot’s capability and perception; performance evaluation, which is based on the actual performance of a robot on a task; trust updating mechanisms that seek to match initial expectations to performance, and team-trust aggregation function that seeks to determine the overall team trust on a robot capability as a means of measuring and determining the final trust score for task allocation. Our model outline is presented in detail in Table I.
